author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Forest Department has strictly warned those residing in villages abutting reserve forests in Vazhappadi block against holding ‘wolf’ jallikattu.

The residents of various villages such as Sinnammanayakkanpalayam; Mathuvar; Periyakrishnapuram; Kottavadi; Gopalapuram; Melavaram; Vadugathampatti; Thamaiyanur used to catch hold of the wolf (vanga nari) from the tehri lands near the reserve forests, and organised Jallikattu on the Kaanum Pongal Day.

This ritual was in existence in these villages for decades together.

The Forest Department imposed a ban on holding this event a couple of decades ago, citing Supreme Court guidelines.

The villagers appealed to the government to withdraw the ban, but the government did not relent. The Forest Department has slapped a ban on holding wolf jallikattu this year too.

Anbazhagam, Forest Ranger, Vazhappadi said that holding the event would invite seven years imprisonment and a fine of Rs. 25,000 under the Wild Life Protection Act.
title: No wolf jallikkattu too
